recipes.name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil for the pasta.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add ground beef and cook, breaking it up, until browned.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Simmer sauce for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions, drain.
Serve pasta topped with sauce and grated parmesan.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry with Vegetables
instructions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and season with salt.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a small bowl.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Stir-fry chicken until golden and cooked through, set aside.
Add more oil if needed, stir-fry vegetables for 3-4 minutes.
Add minced garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds.
Return chicken to the wok, pour in the sauce.
Toss everything together until sauce thickens.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Heat broth in a saucepan and keep warm over low heat.
Sauté sliced mushrooms in butter until golden, set aside.
In the same pan, heat olive oil and cook diced onion until soft.
Add garlic and rice, stir for 2 minutes until rice is toasted.
Pour in white wine and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Continue adding broth until rice is creamy and al dente, about 18-20 minutes.
Stir in mushrooms, parmesan, thyme leaves, and remaining butter.
Season with salt and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Tacos
instructions: Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Drain excess fat and add taco seasoning with a little water.
Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
Warm taco shells according to package directions.
Shred lettuce, dice tomatoes and onion, grate cheese.
Set up a taco bar with all toppings.
Fill shells with seasoned beef and desired toppings.
Squeeze fresh lime juice over tacos before serving.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Lemon Dill
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Mix olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dill, salt, and pepper.
Brush salmon fillets generously with the marinade.
Let marinate for 15 minutes at room temperature.
Toss asparagus with remaining marinade.
Grill salmon skin-side down for 4-5 minutes per side.
Grill asparagus alongside for 3-4 minutes, turning once.
Serve salmon with grilled asparagus and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Vegetable Curry
instructions: Dice potatoes and cut cauliflower into florets.
Heat oil in a large pot, sauté diced onion until golden.
Add minced garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute.
Stir in curry powder, cumin, and turmeric, cook 30 seconds.
Add potatoes, cauliflower, and chickpeas, stir to coat.
Pour in coconut milk and 1 cup water, bring to simmer.
Cook for 20-25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Serve over basmati rice.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad with Grilled Chicken
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Chop romaine lettuce and place in a large bowl.
Shave parmesan cheese using a vegetable peeler.
Add croutons and most of the parmesan to the lettuce.
Toss with caesar dressing.
Top with sliced chicken and remaining parmesan.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the salad and serve.

recipes.name: Homemade Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to highest setting (475-500°F) with pizza stone if available.
Crush tomatoes by hand, mix with minced garlic, salt, and oregano.
Stretch pizza dough into a 12-inch round on a floured surface.
Transfer dough to a pizza peel or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly, leaving a small border.
Tear mozzarella into pieces and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Top with fresh basil leaves and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Thai Green Curry with Shrimp
instructions: Cook jasmine rice according to package directions.
Heat oil in a wok, add curry paste and fry for 1 minute.
Pour in half the coconut milk and stir until combined.
Add remaining coconut milk, bamboo shoots, and bell pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook for 3-4 minutes until pink.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Remove from heat, stir in thai basil and lime juice.
Serve over jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Burger
instructions: Divide beef into 4 equal portions and form into patties.
Season both sides generously with salt and pepper.
Make a small indent in the center of each patty.
Heat grill or skillet to high heat.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side for medium.
Add cheese slice in the last minute of cooking.
Toast burger buns on the grill.
Assemble burgers with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, and sauces.
Serve immediately with your favorite sides.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Cook fettuccine according to package directions, reserve 1 cup pasta water.
Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook in olive oil until done.
Let chicken rest, then slice into strips.
In the same pan, melt butter and sauté minced garlic.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer.
Stir in grated parmesan until melted and smooth.
Add cooked pasta and toss to coat, adding pasta water if needed.
Top with sliced chicken and fresh parsley.
Serve immediately with extra parmesan.

recipes.name: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions, let cool.
Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, slice red onion thinly.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and salt.
Combine quinoa, vegetables, chickpeas, and olives in a large bowl.
Pour dressing over and toss to combine.
Crumble feta cheese on top.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.
Serve at room temperature or chilled.

recipes.name: Honey Garlic Glazed Pork Chops
instructions: Mix honey, soy sauce, minced garlic, and apple cider vinegar.
Season pork chops with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops for 4-5 minutes per side until golden.
Remove pork and set aside.
Pour honey garlic sauce into the pan, simmer for 2 minutes.
Add butter and stir until melted.
Return pork chops to the pan, coat with sauce.
Serve with steamed green beans drizzled with remaining sauce.

recipes.name: Classic French Omelette
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add salt and pepper.
Whisk vigorously until well combined and slightly frothy.
Heat butter in a non-stick pan over medium-low heat.
When butter foams, pour in eggs.
Stir gently with a spatula while shaking the pan.
When eggs are just set but still creamy, stop stirring.
Add grated cheese to one half of the omelette.
Fold omelette in half and slide onto a plate.
Garnish with fresh chives and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Black Bean Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté diced onion until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add minced garlic and diced jalapeño, cook 1 minute.
Stir in cumin and smoked paprika, toast for 30 seconds.
Add drained black beans and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to partially blend, leaving some chunks.
Season with salt and lime juice.
Serve topped with sour cream, cilantro, and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon Rice Bowl
instructions: Cook sushi rice according to package directions.
Combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar in a small pot.
Simmer teriyaki sauce until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
Cook salmon skin-side up for 3 minutes, flip and cook 3 more minutes.
Brush salmon with teriyaki sauce during the last minute.
Slice cucumber and avocado.
Assemble bowls with rice, salmon, edamame, avocado, and cucumber.
Drizzle with remaining teriyaki sauce, top with sesame seeds and nori strips.

recipes.name: Caprese Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut a deep pocket horizontally in each chicken breast.
Season inside and outside with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning.
Slice mozzarella and tomatoes.
Stuff each pocket with mozzarella, tomato slices, and basil leaves.
Secure with toothpicks if needed.
Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken for 3 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer skillet to oven and bake for 15-18 minutes until cooked through.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Fried Rice
instructions: Use day-old cold rice for best results, or spread fresh rice on a tray to cool.
Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Dice carrots and slice green onions, separating white and green parts.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a wok over high heat, scramble eggs, set aside.
Add remaining oil, stir-fry carrots for 2 minutes.
Add garlic and white parts of green onions, cook 30 seconds.
Add rice, breaking up clumps, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add peas, soy sauce, sesame oil, and pepper, toss well.
Return eggs to wok, add green onion tops, toss and serve.
